me.leoko.advancedgui.utils.components

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.leoko.advancedgui.utils.components.Component
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdaptiveComponent, CheckComponent, ClickAnimationComponent, CustomComponent, DummyComponent, GifComponent, GroupComponent, HoverComponent, HoverDetectorComponent, ListComponent, RectangularComponent, RemoteImageComponent, TextComponent, TextInputComponent

    public abstract class Component
extends Object
    A Component is a part of a Layout. A Component is very versatile it its core its task is to define how it is rendered and when happens when it gets clicked on. Most methods have access to the Player, Interaction and Cursor so they they can implement very advanced logic.

        interaction - the interaction this component is used in

      • getState

        public abstract String getState(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                GuiPoint cursor)
        Gets the current state of the component for the given parameters. This methods main purpose is to allow caching and reduce the need to render and send data. This method can be executed very frequently (by default every 50ms for every interacting player) so don't do any heavy calculations here.
        If apply(Graphics, Player, GuiPoint) renders different content, then the this method should return different strings. If it renders the same the return value should be the same.
        A good way to achieve this is to just 'describe' what you would render. (e.g. the RectComponent returns x+"*"+y+"*"+width+"*"+height+"*"+color.getRGB())
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        cursor - the cursor
        Returns:
        the state

      • locate

        public Component locate(String componentId)
        Locate the component with the given id. If this component contains other components then it should search on those as well.
        Parameters:
        componentId - the component id
        Returns:
        the component

      • locate

        public <T extends Component> T locate(String componentId,
                                      Class<T> type)
        Locate the component with the given id and type. If this component contains other components then it should search on those as well. Uses the locate(String) method.
        Parameters:
        componentId - the component id
        Returns:
        the component

      • locateOn

        public Component locateOn(Interaction interaction)
        Locate the same component on a different interaction.
        In most cases return value can safely be casted to concrete component class.
        Alias for:
        interaction.getComponentTree().locate(component.getId())
        Parameters:
        interaction - the interaction
        Returns:
        the component

      • clone

        public abstract Component clone(Interaction interaction)
        Clone the component with the new interaction. Used to copy component tree when initializing new interactions.
        Parameters:
        interaction - the interaction
        Returns:
        the component

        public void onClick(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                    GuiPoint cursor,
                    boolean isPrimary)
        Called when a player clicks on the component.
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        cursor - the cursor
        isPrimary - whether the click is primary (i.e. whether there was no other component in the way)
